perturbation.original_text: Rogers shall pay to Licensor a fee (the "License Fee"), which shall be equal to fifty (50)% of Retail Revenues.   For the purposes of this Agreement, "Retail Revenues" means the retail revenues actually received by Rogers for each authorized exhibition of a Licensed Program on the ROD Service, less GST and applicable sales tax. For greater certainty, Retail Revenues shall not include any fees payable to Rogers for: (i) the purchase, rental or installation of a digital terminal; (ii) any basic or premium television services; or (iii) digital cable access.
perturbation.changed_text: Rogers shall pay to Licensor a fee (the "License Fee") based on Retail Revenues.  For greater certainty, Retail Revenues shall not include any fees payable to Rogers for: (i) the purchase, rental or installation of a digital terminal; (ii) any basic or premium television services; or (iii) digital cable access.
perturbation.explanation: The specific percentage (50%) for the License Fee calculation has been removed. While the term 'Retail Revenues' is still defined, the omission of the percentage introduces ambiguity and uncertainty regarding the actual fee calculation. Other sections rely on the License Fee calculation, creating an inconsistency.

perturbation.original_text: Licensor agrees to pay to Rogers an amount which shall be equal to ten (10)% of License Fees, calculated on a rolling basis during the Term and payable monthly.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensor agrees to pay to Rogers an amount for various services and activities, calculated on a rolling basis during the Term and payable monthly.
perturbation.explanation: The specific percentage (10%) related to the Marketing Allowance based on License Fees has been removed. This creates ambiguity because, without the percentage, the actual amount Licensor needs to pay remains undefined. Section 6(b)(ii)(A) still references this 'marketing allowance'.

perturbation.original_text: For so long as Rogers is required by Applicable Law to contribute a percentage of its gross annual revenues from the ROD Service to an independently-administered Canadian program production fund, Licensor shall reimburse Rogers for 50% of the amount required to be remitted to such production fund by Rogers in respect of the exhibition of Licensed Programs (the "Production Fund Commitment"). The Production Fund Commitment shall be calculated monthly during the Term and shall be deducted as set out in Section 6 (b).
perturbation.changed_text: For so long as Rogers is required by Applicable Law to contribute to an independently-administered Canadian program production fund, Licensor shall reimburse Rogers for a portion of the amount required to be remitted to such production fund by Rogers in respect of the exhibition of Licensed Programs (the "Production Fund Commitment"). The Production Fund Commitment shall be calculated monthly during the Term and shall be deducted as set out in Section 6 (b).
perturbation.explanation: The specific percentage (50%) Licensor is responsible for reimbursing related to the Production Fund Commitment has been removed. Section 6(b)(ii)(B) still mentions the production fund commitment.
